import { motion } from "framer-motion" function YesButton(props) { console.log(props.topColor); const btnStyle = { width: '250px', height: '100px', // transform: 'scale(0.5)', // transformOrigin: 'left', textAlign: 'center', color: 'white', fontSize: '40pt', fontFamily: `${props.font}`, lineHeight: '95px', borderRadius: '12.5px', textStrokeWidth: '1px', textStrokeColor: 'red', border: `1px solid rgba(${props.borderColor.color.r}, ${props.borderColor.color.g}, ${props.borderColor.color.b}, ${props.borderColor.color.a})`, color: `rgba(${props.color.color.r}, ${props.color.color.g}, ${props.color.color.b}, ${props.color.color.a})`, background: `rgba(${props.topColor.color.r}, ${props.topColor.color.g}, ${props.topColor.color.b}, ${props.topColor.color.a})`, backgroundImage: `linear-gradient(rgba(${props.topColor.color.r}, ${props.topColor.color.g}, ${props.topColor.color.b}, ${props.topColor.color.a}), rgba(${props.bottomColor.color.r}, ${props.bottomColor.color.g}, ${props.bottomColor.color.b}, ${props.bottomColor.color.a})`, } return
yesÂ®
} export default YesButton
